stream_context.summary: Kaze works on the new overworld for "Return to Yoshi's Island," mainly reshaping Parts 5 & 7, placing course entrances, plotting a river, secrets, and beach details while battling illness and a full SSD.

development_findings.summary: The original overworld has been scrapped and replaced by a single, much larger overworld map that will contain all course entrances and many secrets.
development_findings.quote: The original overworld is completely erased. It's just not up to the quality standards.

development_findings.summary: Parts 5 and 7 have been merged; Part 8’s entrance (with a Koopa) now sits on the beach hub, and Part 12 (volcano) will be gated behind a climbable Super-Happy-Tree seedling unlocked by collecting enough ‘happiness.’
development_findings.quote: We're just going to fuse the two parts—seven and five—because... there was no way to make a smooth transition here anyway.

development_findings.summary: A river will run across the island; a grate will block players from riding it too far unless it links to secrets such as a star or loop-back to Part 3.
development_findings.quote: Do we make it so that if you fall down the river, you come back out in part one… I guess we can also just make a grate. I think grate is the way.

development_findings.summary: Beach zone redesign goals: add height variation, Yoshi houses, rocks, wooden bridges, sand dunes, and a sand-castle blue-coin mini-game to avoid flat, boring terrain.
development_findings.quote: Walking on this beach sucks… I need a way to make this less flat and boring.

development_findings.summary: Course 6 ‘Jurassic Jungle’ features prehistoric Yoshis with talons; Zeina provided concept art, though the level currently has a microcode bug.
development_findings.quote: These are the prehistoric Yoshis… Stop snooping chump, can’t you see we’re busy?

development_findings.summary: Engine improvements remove thin invisible walls via a different step-function; overall ROM size remains under 60 MB.
development_findings.quote: Hitting an invisible wall just doesn't happen anymore… unless there’s generally like a big invisible wall.

development_findings.summary: Multiplayer is still only a possibility—technically feasible but boss fights (e.g., Raven) would be "really weird."
development_findings.quote: I don't know if multiplayer is going to be in the game… it's mostly boss fights that are going to be jank with it.
And I think we're maybe like 10% done.

development_findings.summary: No physical cartridge release is planned due to legal issues; distribution will be online (YouTube).
development_findings.quote: Are you asking if I'm gonna print cartridges and sell them? The answer is no because of legal issues.

development_findings.summary: Kaze no longer writes raw ASM; relies on decomp and higher-level tooling for optimisation.
development_findings.quote: Some people think I still only do ASM. No, I haven't done ASM in a long time.

context_findings.summary: Kaze is visibly ill and feverish, leading to low energy and early end of stream.
context_findings.quote: Today I'm feeling miserable. More miserable than the last time I streamed.

context_findings.summary: Severe SSD space crisis: Photoshop wouldn’t open; Kaze spent half the stream deleting files and running cleanup tools, recalling a previous SSD failure that cost lost work.
context_findings.quote: My hard drive is so full that I can't open Photoshop… my old SSD broke and I lost a little bit of work to that.

context_findings.summary: Relies on multiple sponsorships (NordVPN, Squarespace, Brilliant) because Twitch ad revenue is insufficient and he needs money for his family.
context_findings.quote: I gotta make money for my family… Twitch ad revenue really, really didn't come in.

context_findings.summary: Creative philosophy favors ‘risky’ experimental games over safe, big-budget titles; admires Yoshi’s Island for its bold design shift.
context_findings.quote: That's the type of shit I want to see—risky games again, not the typical three games Nintendo makes.

context_findings.summary: Expresses frustration with computers and other people's systems; prefers creating new systems.
context_findings.quote: With computers you're just learning about things someone else made. It's not like you're making new systems.

biobak.summary: Joins chat to comment on geometry symmetry issues and general progress; lighthearted banter about needing more sponsors.
biobak.quote: Yeah, I need a bunch of sponsors, Biobak.

zeina.summary: Provided prehistoric Yoshi concept drawings for Course 6; leaves mid-stream; Kaze jokingly plans to convince chat to praise his ‘Wasabi song’ to her.
zeina.quote: This is what Zeina had… doesn't really work, I do want it to be a cave.

key_stories.title: SSD Meltdown
key_stories.summary: Photoshop refused to open because Kaze’s system drive had only 1.6 GB free. Stream derailed into a frantic hunt for deletable files and Windows cleanup tricks.
key_stories.challenge: Critical design files couldn’t be opened due to lack of disk space.
key_stories.process: Deleted unused programs, cache folders, ran Disk Cleanup and DISM under chat guidance.
key_stories.outcome: Freed about 5 GB, allowing him to reopen the project, but resolved to install a new 1 TB SSD soon.
key_stories.key_quote: Are we really gonna spend the whole stream trying to get like 100 MB on my disk?

key_stories.title: Overworld Reboot
key_stories.summary: Kaze decides the previous overworld does not meet quality standards and begins building a single giant overworld with interconnected parts, secrets, and thematic areas.
key_stories.challenge: Old overworld felt disjointed and sub-par.
key_stories.process: Erased prior version, merged Parts 5 & 7, plotted new entrances, rivers, and secret loops while taking design notes live.
key_stories.outcome: Found a coherent layout but noted many placeholders (flat beaches, empty caves) still need detail passes.
key_stories.key_quote: The original overworld is completely erased. It's just not up to the quality standards.
